summary: The Northwest Energy Security Act (H.R. 626) concerns the operation of the Federal Columbia River Power System (FCRPS). It directs the Secretaries of Interior, Energy, and the Army to operate the FCRPS consistently with the 2020 Supplemental Opinion, which details an environmental impact statement. The bill allows the Secretaries to amend sections of the Opinion for public safety, transmission, and grid reliability. It places restrictions on restricting electrical generation at FCRPS hydroelectric dams and limiting navigation on the Snake River, requiring specific federal statute authorization. Clarification is provided on maintaining operations and making maintenance improvements to the facilities.
